Title: [Job Summary][Widget Display]Verify that User can view Job Summary widget as permanent component on dashboard successfully
Description: Test case to verify Job Summary widget is always visible and non-removable on dashboard
Precondition: 1. User has valid login credentials (LK-TEST-1234 / exampleplatform1234); 2. User has successfully logged into staging environment; 3. Dashboard page is accessible and loading properly; 4. User has appropriate permissions to view job data
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard landing page; 2. Locate Job Summary widget in main content area; 3. Verify widget title Job Summary is clearly visible; 4. Check for any close/remove/hide options on widget; 5. Attempt to remove widget if any option exists; 6. Refresh page and verify widget persistence
Expected Result: 1. Job Summary widget is prominently displayed on dashboard; 2. Widget title Job Summary is clearly visible; 3. No close/remove/hide options are available on widget; 4. Widget remains persistent across page refreshes; 5. Widget is treated as mandatory dashboard component
Actual Result: FAILED - Widget has removable/closable option contradicting design requirements (PB-2307)

Title: [Job Summary][Widget Loading]Verify that User can successfully load job data in Job Summary widget
Description: Test case to verify widget loads with proper job data within acceptable timeframe
Precondition: 1. User is successfully logged into dashboard; 2. User account has associated job data; 3. Job Summary widget is visible on dashboard; 4. Network connectivity is stable
Steps: 1. Navigate to dashboard with Job Summary widget visible; 2. Monitor widget loading indicators; 3. Wait for job data to populate; 4. Verify data appears within acceptable timeframe; 5. Check if loading indicators disappear properly
Expected Result: 1. Widget begins loading job data immediately; 2. Loading indicators are displayed during data fetch; 3. Job data populates within 3-5 seconds; 4. Loading indicators disappear when data is loaded; 5. No error messages or empty states displayed
Test Data: Expected job count: Multiple jobs across different statuses; Loading timeout: Maximum 5 seconds
Actual Result: VERIFIED - Widget loads with appropriate job data within expected timeframe

Title: [Job Summary][Date Filter]Verify that User can filter jobs using pre-defined date range buttons successfully
Description: Test case to verify pre-defined date range buttons function correctly
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded with job data; 2. Date range selector is visible at top of widget; 3. Pre-defined buttons (24 hours 7 days 30 days 12 months) are available; 4. Jobs exist across different time periods for testing
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget; 2. Note current date range and job count; 3. Click 24 hours button; 4. Verify date range updates and job data filters; 5. Click 7 days button and verify filtering; 6. Click 30 days button and verify filtering; 7. Click 12 months button and verify filtering; 8. Verify active button state changes for each selection
Expected Result: 1. Each button shows active state when clicked; 2. Date range updates automatically to selected period; 3. Job data refreshes to match selected time period; 4. Job count decreases/increases appropriately for each period; 5. No loading errors or empty states occur
Test Data: Current date range showing jobs; Jobs from last 24 hours 7 days 30 days and 12 months periods
Actual Result: VERIFIED - All pre-defined date range buttons function correctly

Title: [Job Summary][Custom Date]Verify that User can filter jobs using custom date range selection successfully
Description: Test case to verify custom date range selection functionality
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded and functional; 2. Date range selector shows current range; 3. Custom date range option is available; 4. Jobs exist across different dates for filtering validation
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget; 2. Click on date range selector; 3. Select Custom Date Range option; 4. Set start date to 03-04-2025; 5. Set end date to 02-06-2025; 6. Apply date range selection; 7. Monitor job data refresh; 8. Verify job count and date range display
Expected Result: 1. Custom date picker opens properly; 2. Start and end dates can be selected successfully; 3. Applied range shows in proper display format; 4. Job data filters to only show jobs within selected range; 5. Date range validation prevents invalid selections
Test Data: Start Date: 03-04-2025; End Date: 02-06-2025; Expected Result: Only jobs within selected range should display
Actual Result: CRITICAL FAILURE - Custom date range non-functional: Data doesn't refresh; Reverts to 12 months instead of applying custom range

Title: [Job Summary][Date Format]Verify that User can view consistent date formatting across all widget components successfully
Description: Test case to verify consistent date formatting across widget
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded with job data; 2. Multiple tabs contain job data with dates; 3. Date range selector is showing current range; 4. Jobs have various creation dates for comparison
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget; 2. Check date format in date range selector display; 3. Navigate to Completed tab and check job creation dates; 4. Navigate to Contracted tab and check date formatting; 5. Compare date formats across all status tabs; 6. Verify time format consistency
Expected Result: 1. All dates display in consistent DD MMM YYYY format; 2. Time stamps show in consistent 12-hour format; 3. No variations in date formatting across tabs; 4. Date range selector matches job table date formats
Test Data: Expected format: DD MMM YYYY (e.g. 23 Jan 2025 2:30 PM); Various job creation dates across different tabs
Actual Result: FAILED - Date format inconsistencies: Some show YYYY-MM-DD instead of DD MMM YYYY; Contracted tab shows 2025-01-23 14:30 format

Title: [Job Summary][Tab Navigation]Verify that User can navigate through all job status tabs successfully
Description: Test case to verify all job status tabs function correctly
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is fully loaded; 2. All status tabs are visible (Completed Delivery in Progress Notified Contracted Planned); 3. Jobs exist in multiple status categories; 4. Tab navigation controls are functional
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget; 2. Click Completed tab and verify activation; 3. Wait for job data to load and verify content; 4. Click Delivery in Progress tab and verify activation; 5. Click Notified tab and verify activation; 6. Click Contracted tab and verify activation; 7. Click Planned tab and verify activation; 8. Monitor loading times for each tab switch
Expected Result: 1. Each tab activates immediately when clicked; 2. Tab shows active state (highlighted/selected appearance); 3. Appropriate job data loads for each status category; 4. Loading time is under 2 seconds for each tab; 5. No errors or broken states occur during navigation
Test Data: Jobs in different statuses for each tab validation; Expected response time: less than 2 seconds per tab switch
Actual Result: VERIFIED - All tabs navigate properly with appropriate data loading

Title: [Job Summary][UI Consistency]Verify that User can view consistent UI styling across all status tabs successfully
Description: Test case to verify UI consistency across all tabs
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded with data across multiple tabs; 2. All status tabs contain job data for comparison; 3. Figma design references are available for comparison; 4. Browser zoom level is at 100% for accurate comparison
Steps: 1. Navigate through each job status tab sequentially; 2. Compare column spacing and alignment across tabs; 3. Check header formatting and font weights; 4. Verify row height consistency across tabs; 5. Compare progress bar styling in Delivery in Progress tab; 6. Check text wrapping in Notified tab columns; 7. Verify date formatting in Contracted tab
Expected Result: 1. Consistent column spacing and alignment across all tabs; 2. Header fonts are bold and properly formatted; 3. Row heights are uniform across all tabs; 4. Progress bars are thin green and properly aligned; 5. No text wrapping or overflow issues in any columns; 6. Date formatting is consistent across all tabs
Test Data: Figma design specifications for Job Summary widget; Job data present in all tabs for styling comparison
Actual Result: MAJOR UI ISSUES: Column spacing misaligned; Progress bars inconsistent; Text wrapping in Notified tab; Date format issues in Contracted tab

Title: [Job Summary][Data Accuracy]Verify that User can view identical completion percentages across summary and detail views successfully
Description: Test case to verify completion percentage accuracy across different views
Precondition: 1. Delivery in Progress tab contains jobs with completion percentages; 2. Job detail view/Control Tower is accessible; 3. Jobs have varying completion percentages for validation; 4. User has permissions to access both summary and detail views
Steps: 1. Navigate to Delivery in Progress tab; 2. Locate job CP-DOM-250528-2; 3. Note completion percentage displayed in summary table; 4. Click on job row to open detail view; 5. Compare completion percentage in detail panel; 6. Repeat for multiple jobs with different completion levels; 7. Document any discrepancies found
Expected Result: 1. Completion percentages are identical in summary and detail views; 2. Visual progress indicators align with percentage values; 3. No discrepancies between any view of the same job; 4. Percentage calculations are accurate and consistent
Test Data: Test Job: CP-DOM-250528-2 with Reference ID: LSI80-250527-00033 - 1; Expected: Identical percentages in both views
Actual Result: CRITICAL DATA INCONSISTENCY: Summary shows 30% while detail shows 32%; Multiple jobs have different percentages between views

Title: [Job Summary][Distance Display]Verify that User can view properly formatted distance values in Distance column successfully
Description: Test case to verify distance values display with appropriate precision
Precondition: 1. Delivery in Progress tab contains jobs with distance data; 2. Distance (KM) column is visible in job table; 3. Jobs have various distance values including zero values; 4. Column displays decimal values for testing
Steps: 1. Navigate to Delivery in Progress tab; 2. Locate Distance (KM) column in job table; 3. Check decimal precision for multiple distance values; 4. Verify zero value formatting; 5. Check if any values show excessive decimal places; 6. Compare formatting consistency across all distance entries
Expected Result: 1. Distance values are rounded to exactly 3 decimal places; 2. Zero values display as 0.000; 3. No values show more than 3 decimal places; 4. Formatting is consistent across all distance entries; 5. Values are properly aligned in column
Test Data: Expected format: 3 decimal places (e.g. 6.829); Zero values should show as 0.000
Actual Result: FORMATTING ISSUES: Distance values show 15+ decimal places (6.829309754383161 instead of 6.829); Zero values excessive decimals

Title: [Job Summary][Column Sorting]Verify that User can sort job data by clicking column headers successfully
Description: Test case to verify column sorting works across all tabs
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget contains multiple jobs for sorting; 2. All status tabs have sufficient data for sort validation; 3. Sortable columns are clearly identified with sort indicators; 4. Multiple job records exist for meaningful sort comparison
Steps: 1. Navigate to Completed tab; 2. Click on Job Name column header; 3. Verify data sorts in ascending order and sort indicator changes; 4. Click same header again to verify descending sort; 5. Repeat sorting test for each sortable column; 6. Navigate to Delivery in Progress tab and test sorting; 7. Navigate to Notified tab and test sorting; 8. Test sorting on remaining tabs
Expected Result: 1. First click on column header sorts data in ascending order; 2. Second click toggles to descending sort order; 3. Sort indicators (arrows) change to show current sort direction; 4. Data reorders correctly according to column data type; 5. Sorting works consistently across all tabs
Test Data: Sortable columns: Job Name Job Reference ID Load Reference ID Created Date and Time Vehicle ID; Test across all tabs: Completed Delivery in Progress Notified Contracted Planned
Actual Result: CRITICAL FAILURE: Column sorting completely non-functional; Clicking headers doesn't change sort order; Table unresponsive

Title: [Job Summary][Row Click]Verify that User can navigate appropriately when clicking on job rows successfully
Description: Test case to verify job row click navigation works correctly
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget contains jobs in different states; 2. Some jobs have Control Tower access others do not; 3. Jobs in Contract/Planned states are available for testing; 4. Control Tower system is accessible and functional
Steps: 1. Navigate to different job status tabs; 2. Identify jobs in Contract or Planned states; 3. Click on job row without Control Tower access; 4. Observe navigation behavior and any error messages; 5. Navigate to jobs with Control Tower access; 6. Click on job row with Control Tower access; 7. Verify appropriate navigation occurs
Expected Result: 1. Jobs with Control Tower access navigate to CT page successfully; 2. Jobs without CT access navigate to appropriate state-specific view; 3. No error messages or broken navigation states occur; 4. Navigation is contextually appropriate for job state
Test Data: Jobs with Control Tower access: Jobs in active delivery states; Jobs without Control Tower access: Jobs in Contract/Planned states
Actual Result: NAVIGATION ISSUES: All rows clickable even without CT access; Jobs redirect to CT page causing errors for incompatible states

Title: [Job Summary][Fullscreen Mode]Verify that User can access and utilize fullscreen mode functionality successfully
Description: Test case to verify fullscreen mode works correctly
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded and functional; 2. Fullscreen button is visible in widget header; 3. Widget contains job data for fullscreen testing; 4. Browser supports fullscreen dialog functionality
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget; 2. Locate fullscreen button in widget header; 3. Click fullscreen button to activate fullscreen mode; 4. Verify all widget functionality is available in fullscreen; 5. Test tab navigation in fullscreen mode; 6. Test date range filtering in fullscreen mode; 7. Locate and click exit fullscreen option; 8. Verify return to normal widget view
Expected Result: 1. Fullscreen mode displays as popup overlay dialog; 2. All widget controls and functionality remain available; 3. Exit functionality works properly; 4. No data loss occurs during fullscreen toggle; 5. Fullscreen maintains all interactive elements
Test Data: Current widget state with job data loaded; All tabs and functionality available for fullscreen testing
Actual Result: FULLSCREEN ISSUES: Expands entire page instead of popup overlay; Missing filter state management across time ranges

Title: [Job Summary][Progress Bars]Verify that User can view consistent progress bar styling in Delivery in Progress tab successfully
Description: Test case to verify progress bar visual consistency
Precondition: 1. Delivery in Progress tab contains jobs with completion percentages; 2. Progress bars are visible for multiple jobs; 3. Jobs have varying completion percentages (0-100%); 4. Figma design specifications available for comparison
Steps: 1. Navigate to Delivery in Progress tab; 2. Examine progress bar visual consistency across multiple jobs; 3. Check progress bar alignment with percentage values; 4. Compare progress bar heights across different jobs; 5. Verify progress bar color consistency; 6. Check if progress bars align properly with percentage text
Expected Result: 1. Progress bars are thin and consistently styled; 2. All progress bars use consistent green color; 3. Progress bars align properly with completion percentages; 4. Bar heights are uniform across all job entries; 5. Visual appearance matches design specifications
Test Data: Jobs with completion percentages: 8% 14% 33% 55% 100%; Expected: Thin consistent green progress bars
Actual Result: PROGRESS BAR ISSUES: Thick and inconsistent appearance; Alignment issues with percentages; Inconsistent styling across rows

Title: [Job Summary][Keyboard Navigation]Verify that User can navigate Job Summary widget using keyboard only successfully
Description: Test case to verify full keyboard navigation support
Precondition: 1. Job Summary widget is loaded and functional; 2. Browser supports keyboard navigation; 3. All interactive elements are present in widget; 4. Tab order is logically structured
Steps: 1. Navigate to Job Summary widget using mouse; 2. Press Tab key to start keyboard navigation; 3. Navigate through all interactive elements using Tab; 4. Test activation of buttons using Enter/Space keys; 5. Navigate through table using arrow keys; 6. Test tab switching using keyboard; 7. Verify all functionality is keyboard accessible
Expected Result: 1. All interactive elements are keyboard accessible; 2. Tab order follows logical flow; 3. Focus indicators are visible and clear; 4. All functionality can be accessed without mouse; 5. Keyboard shortcuts work as expected
Test Data: Tab key for forward navigation; Shift+Tab for backward navigation; Enter/Space for activation; Arrow keys for table navigation
Actual Result: NEEDS TESTING - Keyboard navigation accessibility requires comprehensive validation
